sub_title: Criminologist specialised in gender-based violence and child protection in emergency settings
summary:
Criminology is based on Psychology and Law and the critical and cultural skills learnt during the Master in Global Criminology let me see social phenomena from a different perspective. There, I discovered my passion for the research field in human trafficking  with a focus on cross-border crimes, gender and intersectionality. 
I have multiple international experiences in Protection in the African and Latin American context and I am always looking for new challenges to grow professionally and personally.

profile_positions.description:
- Provide regular technical support and guidance to Protection Managers (PMs) to strengthen the capacity of protection teams in delivering high-quality PM, CM services, IPA and CBP, while ensuring that supervision and coaching structures are in place at the field level to ensure adequate oversight by PMs.
- Undertake regular field visits to monitor the quality of implementation, provide technical advice, and conduct customized needs assessments to base the capacity building of protection staff on (with specific regard to PM, CM, and IPA).
- Contribute to the establishment and regular updates of the MEAL plan, including ensuring appropriate indicator and quality tracking (both quantitative and qualitative) and working closely with MEAL to put in place accountability mechanisms.
- Develop program tools, and guidance notes to support and reinforce the quality of activities and lead the coaching, mentorship, and training required for implementation.
- Participate in the proposal development process by providing field-specific context analysis, technical sector-specific analysis, beneficiary information, and technical feedback on the concept.
- Active participation in, contribution to, and representation of DRC in the Protection Cluster, and assigned AoRs or other relevant bodies, including working groups and other meetings related to protection.
- Ensure that DRC’s work is coordinated with the efforts of other agencies, ensuring the adoption of mitigation measures are taken to address the protection risks affecting communities.
- Feed into National Protection cluster and other relevant spaces through sharing DRC Protection Monitoring (PM) findings, ensuring that protection analysis is guiding the design of humanitarian responses.
- Promote and implement trainings for all Clusters as well as humanitarian partners on core protection concepts such as the Centrality of Protection, Age, Gender, and Diversity and Community-based Protection.
profile_positions.title: Protection Specialist

profile_positions.description: Unkara is a slow fashion brand, and a social impact movement. Unkara’s mission is to promotes authentic African garments, alleviate textile pollution and create financial independency for marginalized groups through networks and a sustainable business model. Our work is structured in three pillars: 1. Stand against Textile Pollution and Fast Fashion 2. Promote African Authentic Garment 3. Help Female Refugees in Africa
profile_positions.title: Community Outreach Manager

profile_positions.description:
− Lead and manage the protection policies and programmes across the refugee camp in
Kakuma and at the country level (Kenya).
− Manage and coordinate the protection shelters for women survivors of gender basedviolence
(GBV) and children in Kakuma Refugee Camp.
− Programme Manager of Kakuma protection programme regarding safe shelters,
children living with disabilities and mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS).
− Programme Manager of Nairobi protection programme concerning protection and
resettlement referral programmes for urban refugees.
− Coordinate and liaise between JRS and other agencies, including United Nations High
Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), Danish Refugee Council (DRC), other NGOs,
local government and community-based organisations.
− Focal point on all inter-agency working groups regarding Child Protection and GBV.
− Reporting and Data Management.
− Budget Planning and Management.
− Staff Management.
profile_positions.title: Protection Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
- Assist in identifying technical assistance needs for capacity building and develop sustainable strategies to reform and strengthen the capacity of maritime law enforcement and other criminal justice authorities in the region, including on improved detention and transfer activities.
- Assist in the development, implementation and evaluation of the programme activities under the Global Maritime Crime Programme Support to the Prosecutors’ Network, a forum which focuses on international cooperation and mutual legal assistance; and other criminal justice support delivered in the region.
- Assist in project/programme and/or budget revisions, the preparation and dissemination of project documentation on maritime crime and detention and transfer.
- Contribute with substantive support for policy coordination and evaluation functions, including the review and analysis of emerging issues and trends, participation in evaluations or research activities and studies.
- Contribute to the preparation of various written outputs, e.g. draft background papers, briefing notes, analytical notes, sections of reports and studies, inputs to publications, etc, relating to maritime crime and detention issues in the region.
- Provide administrative and substantive support in view of consultative and other meetings, workshops, conferences, etc., including proposing agenda topics, identifying and proposing participants, preparing background documents and presentations, handling logistics, etc.
- Assistance in relation to administrative action and co-ordination of the flow of information and correspondence internally and externally with other departments, agencies and partner organizations i.e., through emails and phone calls.
profile_positions.title: Global Maritime Crime Programme (GMCP) Internship

profile_positions.description:
- Empowering adolescent mothers and orphan girls through socio-educational workshops.
- Developing and conducting games and activities for children and adolescents to promote gender equality.
- Discussing about gender stereotypes with children and adolescents.
profile_positions.title: Leadership Development Experience tackling the Sustainable Development Goal Gender Equality
